artist: Russell A. Frisbie J. & E. Stevens Company, Cromwell, Connecticut, 1843-1950s
description: silver colored metal pay phone with open work back; wood ear piece connected with string; coin slots for 5, 10 and 25 cents; crank on one side rings bell when turned; on front, raised letters: 'Pay Phone Bank'
marks:
Inscription; Sticker

stamped on back: [PAT. APL
title: "Pay Phone" mechanical bank
